PERSONA:
Name: Ethan Thompson

Age: 38 years

Sex: Male

Race: White

Ethnicity: Non-Hispanic

Location: Laramie, Wyoming, residing in a modest, single-family home in a suburban neighborhood with his parents.

Household Relationship: Lives with his parents, both in their early sixties, who own the home. Ethan's father is a retired school teacher, and his mother works part-time at a local library.

Marital Status: Divorced. Ethan was married from 2015 to 2020 and has a 7-year-old daughter who lives with her mother in another part of the state. Ethan has visitation rights and sees his daughter every other weekend.

Education: Ethan attended the University of Wyoming, where he studied business administration but did not graduate due to financial constraints. He completed about 60 credits over three years before dropping out.

Employment Status: Currently not in the labor force. Ethan previously worked as a sales representative for a local outdoor gear store but was laid off in 2020 due to the pandemic. He has been looking for employment but has not had success in his job search.

Economic Situation: Ethan's parents support him financially, covering his living expenses. He receives child support from his ex-wife, which helps with his daughter's care during his visitation periods. Ethan's annual income is approximately $20,000, mostly from occasional freelance work and selling items online.

Concerns and Priorities: Ethan's primary economic concerns include finding stable employment, managing his debt (about $10,000 in student loans and credit card debt), and rebuilding his life after the divorce. He is also concerned about his daughter's well-being and ensuring he can provide for her future. Politically, Ethan leans towards policies supporting job creation, education, and family welfare.
